page.title: 13CUCKFIELD-COMMUNICATION
page.content: Most people prefer to use first class mail although it is more expensive than second class (17p as against 13p) Most houses in Cuckfield have a telephone. People lazily prefer to telephone rather than write a letter. There are six telephone kiosks in Cuckfield. The minimum charge for a call is 10p. Of all the other ways of obtaining information, books and libraries are still very popular. Surprisingly few people (12%) use Teletext. When asked to name the one medium that they would turn to for the latest news coverage most people said television. Radio and newspapers were the next most popular.
